div.div: Τῡδεύς : Tydeus, son of Oeneus, king of Calydon in Aetolia, and father of Diomed, Il. 5.813, 163, Il. 6.96. While a fugitive at Argos he married the daughter of Adrastus, and joined Polynīces in the expedition of the Seven against Thebes, Il. 4.376 ff.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
